Physiological: Husk colour turns pale brown 25 to 30 days after tasseling
index: 600 g of maize grains per kg of cob (0.6)
Conditions_ during:
Optimum moisture content in grain at harvesting should be around 20 %. The harvested cobs should spread evenly instead of making heap Observe the following symptoms, taking into consideration the average duration of the crop. 
1. The sheath covering the cob will turn yellow and dry at maturity. 
2. The seeds become fairly hard and dry. At this stage the crop is ready for harvest. Tear off the cob sheath by using the gunny needle and remove the cobs from the plant. 
3. Carry out harvest operations at a single stage for easy transportation. Optimum moisture content in grain at harvesting should be around 20 %. The harvested cobs should spread evenly instead of making heap
prevent:
1. Seed drying should be done till the moisture content of the seed is reduced to 8 % and it should be kept in aerated jute bags. 
2. Seed should be stored at cool and dry place preferably in cold storage. 
3. Marketing should be done with specifications and standards.
